citations.narrative:
An approximately 5-foot portion of the outdoor primary enclosure's metal wall for the 74 domestic rabbits has severe
rusting at the bottom portion that comes into contact with the soil substrate. There are a few sharp points and
approximately 1.5 inch holes in the wall due to extent of rusting. Heavily rusted metal walls in an enclosure may cause
injury to animals or allow their escape. Indoor and outdoor housing facilities for rabbits shall be structurally sound and
shall be maintained in good repair, to protect the animals from injury, to contain the animals and to restrict the entrance of
other animals.
Correct by 22 August 2024.

There are not enough perches available for 5 fledgling rainbow lorikeets housed together in a wire cage primary
enclosure. The single wooden perch has enough space for 3 rainbow lorikeets to perch, but 2 must stand on the metal
wire floor. Failure to provide adequate space for perching for all birds in a primary enclosure may cause discomfort and
injury to the birds. If the enclosure houses birds that rest by perching, there must be perches available that are
appropriate to the age and species of birds housed therein and a sufficient number of perches to comfortably hold all birds
in the primary enclosure at the same time. Corrected at time of inspection.
Correct from this date forward of 23 July 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.50(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
An approximately 5-foot portion of the outdoor primary enclosure's metal wall for the 74 domestic rabbits has severe 
rusting at the bottom portion that comes into contact with the soil substrate. There are a few sharp points and 
approximately 1.5 inch holes in the wall due to extent of rusting. Heavily rusted metal walls in an enclosure may cause 
injury to animals or allow their escape. Indoor and outdoor housing facilities for rabbits shall be structurally sound and 
shall be maintained in good repair, to protect the animals from injury, to contain the animals and to restrict the entrance of 
other animals. 
 
Correct by 22 August 2024. 
3.153(a)(2) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
There are not enough perches available for 5 fledgling rainbow lorikeets housed together in a wire cage primary 
enclosure. The single wooden perch has enough space for 3 rainbow lorikeets to perch, but 2 must stand on the metal 
wire floor. Failure to provide adequate space for perching for all birds in a primary enclosure may cause discomfort and 
injury to the birds. If the enclosure houses birds that rest by perching, there must be perches available that are 
appropriate to the age and species of birds housed therein and a sufficient number of perches to comfortably hold all birds 
in the primary enclosure at the same time. Corrected at time of inspection. 
 
Correct from this date forward of 23 July 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
